Title: FG deploys 240 electric tricycles across 12 universities
Summary: 240 electric solar-powered tricycles have been procured and deployed by the Federal Government to 12 universities nationwide . Two universities in each geopolitical zone receive 20 of the tricycle . Flagged off the initiative yesterday at the University of Lagos .

Title: Tinubu has a police palaver
Summary: Olusegun Obasanjo returned as the president of Nigeria in May 1999, according to Mohammed Dikko (MD) Yusuf, a former Inspector-General of Police, (IGP) he “inherited a Police Force that was poorly equipped, decimated in numerical strength, deprived of necessary resources .

Title: AFCON 2025: Super Eagles arrive Egypt Dec.10 for international friendly
Summary: Nigeria’s delegation for the international friendly between the Pharaohs of Egypt and the Super Eagles will depart for Cairo on December 10 . Egypt and Nigeria will meet in an international friendly match scheduled for December 14 .

Title: Tiny predicts ‘sad day’ for Happy Boy at GOtv Boxing Night 34
Summary: Durotimi ‘Tiny’ Agboola predicts ‘sad day’ for Happy Boy at GOtv Boxing Night 34 . National super bantamweight champion, Tiny, is the latest fighter to lay claims to superior power over his opponent .

Title: Amusa Kelani dedicates Ikeja Championship victory to caddie, others
Summary: Amusa Kelani dedicates his victory to his caddie and other club members . Kelani beat a strong field of over 100 golfers to win the 2025 Ikeja Golf Club Championship .

Title: Gov Adeleke resigns from PDP
Summary: Governor Ademola Adeleke has resigned his membership from the party . With less than 24 hours to the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, governorship primary election, he has resigned .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 2, 2025
Summary: The exchange rate between the United States Dollar (USD) and the Nigerian Naira (NGN) showed continued stability across both the official and parallel markets on Tuesday, December 2, 2025 .

Title: Some Tinubu’s ambassadorial nominees should be in prison, says Amb Joe Keshi
Summary: Former permanent secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ambassador Joe Keshi, has faulted the ambassadorial list sent to the Senate by President Bola Tinubu for confirmation . Some of the nominees should be in prison, he says .

Title: Ex-manager confirms 2Baba’s arrest in London
Summary: Innocent Idibia a.k.a 2Baba was arrested in London after he had a heated altercation with his pregnant wife, Natasha Osawaru . The former manager of the late Nigerian music legend, Christy Essien-Igbokwe has confirmed the arrest .

Title: Terrorism: US, France, UK backing Nigeria with technical support — Ribadu
Summary: The international community is standing firmly with Nigeria in the fight against terrorism, says the National Security Adviser, Mallam Nuhu Ribadu . The United States, France and the United Kingdom are already providing technical support to ongoing security operations .

Title: Borno mother laments daughter’s third month in B’Haram custody
Summary: Aisha Muhammad Ajah, 15, was forcefully taken away by elements of Boko Haram terriorists on August 9, in Kirawa, a border community in Borno State . The abducted girl has spent almost three months in the captivity of the terrorists yet with no trace of her whereabouts . Her mother Hajia Maimuna Ajah

Title: Nigerians abroad demand action on passport, NIN delays
Summary: Nigerians under the aegis of the International Advocacy for Human Rights and Anti-Corruption, Concerned Nigerians in Germany, and the Nigeria Business Forum, Switzerland, urged the government to address the delays affecting NIN and passport processing . The Diaspora groups made this known in a statement on Monday, jointly signed by

Title: ‘Joshua, Paul fighting for money’
Summary: British-Nigerian boxer Anthony Joshua and YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul will fight in Miami on December 19 . Promoter Eddie Hearn confirmed Joshua will receive his biggest purse to date, adding that the former two-time unified heavyweight champion remains focused on long-term plans beyond the Paul clash . Title: Ex-CDS Musa meets Tinubu as Irabor dismisses B’Haram recruitment claim
Summary: Former Chief of Defence Staff, General Christopher Musa (retd.), visited President Bola Tinubu at the Presidential Villa, Abuja . It was his first public meeting with the President since his retirement on October 24, 2025 . Former CDS, Gen. Lucky Irabor (Retd.), dismissed claims that repentant Boko Haram

Title: Aviation tax removal requires  govt consensus, says Keyamo
Summary: Festus Keyamo said the removal of taxes in the aviation sector cannot be decided by one individual, noting that such policies are subject to collective government approval and legislative review . The minister clarified that despite industry pressure over multiple taxation, tax removal lies beyond the jurisdiction of the aviation ministry .
